title: Expiration of licenses; out-of-country active duty military personnel and dependents
context: ยง286-106.5 Expiration of licenses; out-of-country active duty military personnel and dependents. Notwithstanding section 286-106, the expired driver&rsquo;s license of a member of any component of the United States armed forces who is on active federal service, or the member&rsquo;s dependent if the dependent accompanied the member, and whose driver&rsquo;s license expired while the member was deployed outside the United States, shall remain valid for ninety days after the service member&rsquo;s return to the United States. [L 2008, c 50, ยง1; am L 2012, c 22, ยง1]
